benchmark_details.name: VLind-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: VLind-Bench is the first benchmark specifically designed to measure the language priors, or blindness, of various Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) and disentangle the root causes of their failures.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To accurately measure language priors in LVLMs and evaluate various capabilities such as commonsense knowledge, visual perception, and commonsense biases.

data.source: Generated via prompts with oversight from graduate students.
data.annotation: Manual verification by three graduate students.

methodology.calculation: Scores represent the average of the indicator values across all instances that have passed previous tests.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate lesser reliance on language priors.
methodology.validation: Conducted using handcrafted evaluation sets to ensure reliability.
